pros: Stock goes up, good team mates, good team culture, diversity

pros: Pay is good compared to with other companies in Seattle. Bar is relatively low.

pros: The pay and benefits are decent. Some employees and managers are gems that will help develop your career

summary: No career growth after a while

pros: Organization has good WLB, some opportunities for career growth and managers are very hit or miss

pros: Team worked on interesting projects, great pay for new grad, and a fast-paced environment
cons: Had to work long hours, high pressure, work-life balance struggles
reasonResign: Found a better opportunity at a startup with equal pay and better work-life balance

pros: Work with some of the smartest people in the world. Great comp. Exciting work.
cons: Work with some people who think they are the smartest people in the world. No honesty from top level leadership. Lots of churn through RTO. Get all your information from Business Insider before managers even know about it. 4 year cliff. Lots of pointless docs.

pros: Good place to learn, decent TC if you are a top performer

pros: Good Pay, all the major benefits such as medical, leaves etc

pros: challenging and interesting work, great learning opportunities. smart colleagues. benefits of a large company.

pros: You get employee discounts on Amazon and Career Choice Opportunities

pros: Ability to invent and move fast is a huge win here.  I know it’s an KP but true
cons: Covid really changed culture and messed a ton of things up

pros:
Great for career growth, you get to work on a lot of AWS related tech with competent co-workers. WLB and culture can be team dependent, I’ve been lucky in this regard and it’s not as bad as some of the other teams at Amazon. Amazon also makes it easy to transfer internally (provided you have a good standing),

Overall, good pay, decent perks (subsidized car rentals, upto 400 dollars in commuter benefits, a few discounts here and there)
cons:
Focus and PIP culture but this seems to be the norm everywhere in 2025. Can be difficult to get help on work related tasks since everyone in your team is likely always busy and you’re left on your own to figure things out (may or may not be a bad thing)

Perks are lacking when compared to some other big tech. WLB and politics can be hell if you’re not fortunate with your team selection)

summary: people fight over work to not do it
pros: work reaches a lot of people and people are smart
cons: everyone fights over commas in documents and over what work they want to own but then don't do anything with the work

pros: Engaging work culture and interesting problems to work on. Like it.

pros: Good learning and earning. Learning curve is good. Leadership quality.
